channel.title: Need a custom ::pickup command!
channel.description: Ok, hi i need a custom ::pickup command.......I know this is not a spoon feed site but I have no idea to right this....Please help? What i want the command to be is "Pickup" then the = 3 rights because i want it only for me to do....... HELP PLEASE! I want the item to be a rare 1050 (Santa) then i'll edit it all from there. Thanks!

item.title: Need a custom ::pickup command!
item.dc:creator: @Bubbsy7 Bubbsy7
item.description:
@Bubbsy7 wrote:

Yes that’s what I’m saying…Can anyone else help??

Read full topic

item.title: Need a custom ::pickup command!
item.dc:creator: @roguex roguex
item.description:
@roguex wrote:

If its only for you to use you could use playerName instead of playerRights like so:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerName==“name”)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Wrong syntax Use as ::pickup itemid quantity");
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

@Bubbsy7 wrote:

You guys don’t understand what i’m say…I ALREADY HAVE A PICKUP COMMAND! I want to make it so it’s like ::pickup 1050 1 sendmessage you need lvl 3 rights to get that…But i still want admins (lvl 2 rights) to still be able to pickup!

item.title: Need a custom ::pickup command!
item.dc:creator: @pk_man_owned pk_man_owned
item.description:
@pk_man_owned wrote:

umm its used as ::pickup 1050 1

but now if its less than 5 digits long then u got to add a 0 in the front till it’s 5 digits long

for example: it would now be ::pickup 01050 1

but all these commands are wak here is a right’s 2 command for pickup with a custom lign =)

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); 
            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Wrong sytnax retrd! Use as ::pickup 01050 1! ");
        }
    }</blockquote>

Read full topic

");[/quote]You didn’t make that, I recognize the “cmon type it agian” with the bad spelling from another source. You leeched it, which is making it to you.

item.title: Need a custom ::pickup command!
item.dc:creator: @CripScape_Jeff CripScape Jeff
item.description:
@CripScape_Jeff wrote:

}
if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights == 3)) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sendMessage(“Use as ::pickup 995 200”);

Read full topic

item.title: Need a custom ::pickup command!
item.dc:creator: @vrac_defiled vrac defiled
item.description:
@vrac_defiled wrote:

i have a ::pickup

} if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 3)) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("Use as ::pickup 995 200");

so then if you want to get a santa just do ::pickup 1050 1.

=============================================================================

EDIT:

[quote=“boomer4456, post:2, topic:228369”]this is a basic one i coded in my last source tell me if it worked for ya

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist"); } } catch (Exception e) { sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! ");[/quote]

This will work but i dont really like that type of pickup. Also he said that he wanted for owners only. Yours is for mods too
